article.paragraph: Stroustrup has amaster's degreeinmathematicsandcomputer science(1975) fromAarhus University, Denmark, and aDoctor of PhilosophyPh.D.in computer science (1979) from theUniversity of Cambridge, England.His thesis advisor in Cambridge wasDavid Wheeler (computer scientist)David Wheeler.cite thesisPhDBjarneStroustrupCommunication and control in distributed computer systemsUniversity of Cambridge1979http://ulmss-newton.lib.cam.ac.uk/vwebv/holdingsInfo?bibIdBjarne Stroustrupcite webhttp://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?idDavid WheelerThe Mathematics Genealogy ProjectDepartment of Mathematics, North Dakota State University29 January 2014
article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: Stroustrup began developing C++ in 1978 (then called "C (programming language)Cwith Classes"), and, in his own words, "invented C++, wrote its early definitions, and produced its first implementation... chose and formulated the design criteria for C++, designed all its major facilities, and was responsible for the processing of extension proposals in the C++ standards committee."The C++ Programming Language, B. Stroustrup, p.10Stroustrup also wrote a textbook for the language,The C++ Programming Language.

Stroustrup was the head ofBell LabsAT&T Bell Labs'Large-scale Programming Research department, from its creation until late 2002. Stroustrup was elected member of theNational Academy of Engineeringin 2004. He is a Fellow of theAssociation for Computing MachineryACM(1994) and anInstitute of Electrical and Electronics EngineersIEEEFellow. He works atTexas A&M Universityas a Distinguished Professor where he holds the College of Engineering Endowed Chair inComputer Science.Bjarne Stroustrup: Some Information about Bjorne Stroustrup.Texas A&M CSE Department's Faculty DirectoryHe is also a visiting faculty in Computer Science Department at Columbia University.ITMO Universitynoble doctor since 2013

In 2015, he was made a FellowCite webBjarne Stroustrup— CHM Fellow Award WinnerCHMhttp://www.computerhistory.org/fellowawards/hall/bios/Bjarne,Stroustrup/March 30, 2015of theComputer History Museumfor his invention of the C++ programming language.
